summary: Heavy water is a special type of water where the hydrogen atoms are replaced with a heavier isotope called deuterium. This makes it denser and gives it unique properties. It's used in nuclear reactors and scientific research. Heavy water looks and tastes almost the same as regular water, but it can be harmful to living things if consumed in large amounts. It's made through a specific process and is used in various scientific and industrial applications, like studying molecules and producing radioactive materials.
title: Heavy water
